node.title: Full transcript: Vice President Kamala Harris on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is the full transcript of an interview with Vice President Kamala Harris that aired Sunday, December 26, 2021, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: Faith Salie on saying "grace"
node.description: The "Sunday Morning" contributor suggests her own Word of the Year – one that has taken on many meanings in a challenging time.

node.title: Hail and farewell: A tribute to those we lost in 2021
node.description: "Sunday Morning" remembers some of the creative, inspiring and newsworthy men and women who'd touched us in unforgettable ways, and left us with wisdom, love, and the satisfaction of lives well-lived.

node.title: The defiance of Ludwig van Beethoven
node.description: He was a composer of extraordinary gifts, but he had to overcome a lifetime of maladies – including hearing loss – to compose his masterwork: the Ninth Symphony, with its optimistic final movement.

node.title: The year in review: 2021's most popular movies, music and books
node.description: "Sunday Morning" looks back at the tops in pop culture from the past year.

node.title: Peter Dinklage on recasting the hero of "Cyrano"
node.description: The famously private "Game of Thrones" star talks about a new film adaptation of the play "Cyrano de Bergerac," featuring Dinklage as the ghostwriter of love letters wooing the beautiful Roxanne.

node.title: Reconstructing Notre Dame Cathedral
node.description: "Sunday Morning" gets rare access to the interior of the Parisian landmark as it undergoes repairs following the devastating 2019 fire – and talks with the former military general in charge of completing the effort by 2024.

node.title: The year in review: Top news stories of 2021 month-by-month
node.description: "Sunday Morning" host Jane Pauley looks back on key events of a dramatic year.

node.title: The universal nostalgia for "Take Me Home, Country Roads"
node.description: A song about a longing for home, John Denver's first hit in 1971 has been embraced by West Virginia in a big way, and has been appropriated by singers around the world looking for their very own "place I belong."

node.title: Americans have mixed feelings when looking back on 2021
node.description: For many, 2021 was filled with more happiness than 2020.

node.title: Desmond Tutu, Nobel laureate and anti-apartheid leader, dies at age 90
node.description: South Africa's first Black archbishop rose to prominence during anti-apartheid struggle, went on to become a global campaigner for human rights

node.title: The search for Forrest Fenn's treasure
node.description: Did the benefits outweigh the risks of a millionaire's sometimes-deadly modern-day treasure hunt?

node.title: Natalie Wood death: Investigator calls new witnesses "very credible"
node.description: Nearly four decades after the mysterious drowning death of the Hollywood star,  Los Angeles County Sheriff's investigators disclose  new clues, new witnesses and a person of interest in the case to "48 Hours."

node.title: Armed intruder arrested at Windsor Castle
node.description: The suspect, a 19-year-old man from Southampton, did not enter any buildings on the grounds.

node.title: Winter storm hits West for Christmas
node.description: Parts of California are getting a white Christmas, with snowfall pounding mountains across the state.

node.title: Alec Baldwin posts holiday message thanking supporters following shooting
node.description: The actor said "not a day goes by" that he doesn't think about the fatal shooting.

node.title: LAPD officer placed on leave as officials investigate shooting that killed girl
node.description: California Department of Justice will oversee the investigation into the shooting that killed a suspect and an innocent bystander.

node.title: La Palma's longest volcanic eruption officially declared over
node.description: The volcanic eruption was the island of La Palma's longest active eruption on record, officials said.

node.title: Astronomers discover record-breaking group of "rogue planets"
node.description: It's the largest number of the mysterious cosmic nomads ever discovered.

node.title: Why "It's a Wonderful Life" continues to stand the test of time
node.description: "It's a Wonderful Life" debuted 75 years ago — but it wasn't an instant commercial success.

node.title: El Salvador frees 3 women imprisoned for abortions
node.description: The women had been sentenced to 30 years in prison under the nation's strict anti-abortion laws after suffering obstetric emergencies, activists said.

node.title: Queen Elizabeth's Christmas message touches on love and loss
node.description: "Although it's a time of great happiness and good cheer for many, Christmas can be hard for those who have lost loved ones," the queen said. "This year, especially, I understand why."

node.title: Special tradition behind Boston Common's Christmas tree
node.description: Nova Scotia sent Boston a Christmas tree as a gesture of thanks in 1918 — a gift repeated in 1971 and every year since.

node.title: Duchess of Cambridge performs moving Christmas piano song
node.description: The royal wowed a Christmas Eve audience with a beautiful piano performance alongside singer-songwriter Tom Walker.

node.title: COVID outbreak hits another Florida-based cruise ship
node.description: Carnival Freedom cruise was denied entry to Bonaire and Aruba after an undisclosed number of passengers and crew tested positive.

node.title: Dozens reported dead in Myanmar massacre
node.description: A witness who spoke to the Associated Press said the bodies were tied up with rope and set on fire.

node.title: Pope, in Christmas message, prays for unity and an end to pandemic
node.description: In his Christmas Day address, Pope Francis urged urge health care for all, vaccines for the poor and dialogue to resolve the world's conflicts.

node.title: Christmas Powerball prize could reach $400 million
node.description: It's the third time this year that the prize has reached the $400 million mark.

node.title: 3 Hong Kong universities remove Tiananmen Square monuments
node.description: Government officials have been quelling dissent in Hong Kong ever since Beijing imposed a national security law.

node.title: How to watch NASA's James Webb Space Telescope launch on Christmas
node.description: NASA and its international partners are launching the most expensive science probe ever built — a $10 billion effort to explore the origins of the universe.
